results.title: Rick Stein's seafood lovers guide
results.brief_description: Renowned chef Rick Stein takes a languid journey along the coastline of the United Kingdom in search of the best seafood places to eat and where to get the best produce when cooking fish yourself. Rick cooks an assortment of dishes using mackerel, Portland squid, dover sole, gurnard, herring, wolffish, haddock, mussels, smokies, Penclawdd oysters, monkfish, Mount’s Bay pilchards, abalone. He also calls in on the Blessing of the nets in Brighton, the Dieppe Street Market, Pilchard Press Works plus numerous other venues. Beautiful photography and delicious dishes make this a gastronomic as well as a armchair traveller’s delight.

results.title: Rick and Morty
results.creator_credit: Williams Street, Harmonius Claptrap, Justin Roiland's Solo Vanity Card Productions and Starburns Industries
results.brief_description: Rick is a mentally-unbalanced but scientifically-gifted old man who has recently reconnected with his family. He spends most of his time involving his young grandson Morty in dangerous, outlandish adventures throughout space and alternate universes. Compounded with Morty’s already unstable family life, these events cause Morty much distress at home and school.

constellations_other.name: Webwurlds
constellations_other.description: Jess Johnson and Simon Ward's work is inspired by science fiction and fantasy. Johnson's hand-drawn illustrations are heavily detailed with geometric patterns and incorporate anthropomorphic characters amongst architectural environments in immersive other worlds.

results.title: Rick -File X258375
results.creator_credit: National Institute of Mental Health (U.S.) and University of California, Los Angeles
results.brief_description: Demonstrates how the probation service responds to a youthful narcotics offender who - unbeknownst to the people coming into contact with him - is a probation employee himself. This film shows Rick assuming the role of ‘offender” and going through the same interview process as actual offender would go through.

results.title: Richmond 150 years on
results.brief_description: Inner city Richmond (Victoria) celebrates its 150th birthday. Local residents, shop-keepers, community leaders including Ian “Molly” Meldrum and Peter Norden have their say about their beloved Richmond. Whether born there or a recent newcomer, Richmond it seems, is a place of community, fierce loyalty and respect for your neighbour. Includes some wonderful images of past and present including the MCG, Punt Road, Bridge Road, Swan Street, remains of old factories such as Rosella and archival stills of local street scenes. Narrated by Rob Clancy.

results.title: Riches of the Veldt: South Africa
results.creator_credit: Bill Colleran, Louis De Rochemont and United World Films
results.brief_description: This film opens with a glimpse of the natives in their villages. These villages furnish native labour for the farms, cities and mines of the country. We are shown glimpses of Johannesburg, which lies on a plateau and developed out of the extensive gold-mining operations in that region. A visit to a mining engineer and his family living in the suburbs indicates that their traditions derive from the Dutch and English who constituted the original white population. There are views of the large cattle ranches on the veldt, the orange groves, and, in the south, grape country. The processes of gold mining and the demand mines at Kimberly are shown. The film closes with views of Captetown, the seaport.

results.title: Riches of the Earth. Rev. ed.
results.creator_credit: Barry Helmer, Sidney Goldsmith and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Colourful animation illustrates how Canada’s underground resources took shape through geological ages, and how theses riches of the earth have become our raw materials. We see the formation, by fire, water, wind and ice, of the earth’s crust, with its wealth of minerals, coal, arable land and water.

results.title: Richard Wilson [Widescreen]
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “TheEYE”.
Part of a series of interview-based profiles of contemporary visual artists in Britain. Richard Wilson is an internationally-renowned sculptor and installation artist who often works on an architectural scale. By turns amusing and disturbing, Wilson’s creations are about upsetting our preconceptions of who we are and what kind of world we live in. In this profile, Wilson outlines the genesis and meanings of a selection of key works, including ‘Slice of Reality’, a 20-metre-high cross-section of 600-ton dredger set in the Thames riverbed near the Millennium Dome. Like this monument to Britain’s shipping industry, many of Wilson’s works are created for specific places, and he reflects here on this, on the importance of collaboration and on his spectacular performances throughout the 1980s with Paul Burwell and Anne Bean in the Bow Gamelan Ensemble.

results.title: Richard Takes a Train Ride
results.creator_credit: Stanley Hawes, Joan Boundy and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: A junior school film in the Social Studies series. Describes events on a rail trip from Murray Bridge, on the Victoria-South Australian border to Adelaide; purchase of tickets; work of porters; views of countryside en route; work of the conductor; tunnels; and finally, arrival at Adelaide.
